actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A bill to amend section 502(b) of the Mutual Security Act of 1954 to place limitations on the use of nonexcess local currencies and excess local currencies by Members and committee employees traveling in a foreign country.

summary.text: Provides, under the Mutual Security Act, that no nonexcess or excess local currencies may be made available to any Member of Congress or Congressional committee employee for local currency expenses in any foreign countries if such funds are made available for such expenses from the U.S. Government, any foreign government, or any private source. States that Congress may appropriate no funds for such purpose if unds for such purpose are made available from any foreign government or private source.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 502(b) of the Mutual Security Act of 1954 to place limitations on the use of nonexcess local currencies and excess local currencies by Members and committee employees traveling in a foreign country.
